column4: anyone knows how to start a daemon automatically at the system startup?
does the app already have an init script?
yes
then use update-rc.d
thanks! that will do
what happens when you try this.   sudo invoke-rc.d apache restart
or perhaps.   sudo invoke-rc.d apache2 restart
same thing
does the command give you any output, error messages, etc ??
no, apache can start and stop with no problem aparently
is apache running?   ps aux | grep -i apache
yes
what ports is apache configured to listen on?    grep Listen /etc/apache2/ports.conf
perhaps your firewall is blocking connection attempts to port 80 then?  do you have a  firewall running?
i dont think i have one...
ps aux returns nothing like a firewall to me
how can i make sure?
sudo iptables -L   # if iptables is in use
sudo ufw status # if ufw is in use, i think - i am not sure about this one tho
humn... no ufw command here :p
